page.title: 10Thurlow church & community
page.content: Sunday school no longer exists, but the rector is in contact with younger children through the school brass rubbing sessions, and activity afternoons during school holidays. A lively church magazine, a combined effort of rector and village spreads the word about not only national concerns and local church matters but also local fund raising events. The annual Garden Festival is a popular event attracting crowds to private gardens all over the village, and the Suffolk Historic Churches Trust Cycle Ride raises money through sponsored cyclists visiting as many churches as possible in this corner of the diocese. The chior consists of several village ladies and like most villages, Thurlow has its flower arranging rota.
